From: "dph of rules " <dph_of_rules@...>

Here's something horrible.  You summon a defense and your clerics run 
away to fight other enemies.  Then, a cleric yells for help.  Whose 
fault is it that the cleric dies?  Or another thing.  I summon a 
defense, but my cleric insists on doing his own thing or worse yet, 
becomes frozen stiff.  I swear clerics need to be re-programmed to be 
more team players than individuals.  If enemy clerics would 
consentrate on protecting others, I would swear I would never be able 
to win.

I am trying to play through gladiator with 2 clerics and 2 mages.  
I'll let one become an archmage.  Smaller teams mean everyone gets 
upgrades quicker but have problems taking on large numbers at a time. 
 Larger teams means slower upgrades but fewer problems taking on
large 
numbers at a time.  When I finish through with 2 clerics and 2 mages, 
I may try a team of 2 clerics, 2 mages, and 2 elves.

My own problem with mages is that they frequently run out of magic 
power when engaging the enemy.  I really think that a mage should be 
treated as a spy unless the mage has a super high power level.  
Speaking of which, is there a intelligence level high enough for a 
mage to continously teleport without running out of magic power?

Does anyone know how to use a thief effectively?  I discovered that 
theives are usually more trouble than their worth because of a
tendacy 
to create bombs if they are not busy.

One small question:  is anyone tried to make an RP out of characters 
from this game?
